page.title: 01Valleys east of Penrhyncoch
page.content: This is a rural area consisting of 3 shallow valleys grazed predominantly by sheep with some cattle in the valley bottoms. The fields are small separated by hedges on lower slopes and fences on the ridges. The fields on the ridges provide rougher grazing and there is some bracken encroachment. The Forestry Commission has some plantaions on the hills. Penrhyncoch is the largest village in the area, with several new housing estates curently being built there. The village is mainly residential with people travelling to work in nearby town of Aberystwyth. Although ore english people are moving in the village, there is still a large proportion of Welsh speakers livng in the area. 2 village schools are still operating in the valley.
